info.name: Spinal cord, anterolateral sulcus
info.description: The anterolateral sulcus is AKA the ventral lateral sulcus.  This is a poorly defined sulcus marked by the exit of the ventral roots of the spinal cord. This sulcus extends rostrally into the medulla where it separates the pyramid from the olive. The rootlets of the hypoglossal nerve emerge from this sulcus in the rostral medulla.
